DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Internet e partecipazione politica. Uno studio comparato tra V-Day e No B-Day

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Starting from the discussion of the literature on the relations between internet and political participation, the article presents some research questions about the traditional mediation of political participation within representative democracies: the political system, and the media system. Are the digital media able to favor a process of disintermediation taking away power to the traditional political mediators and facilitating the access of citizens to the political power? Are the digital media able to break the so-called asymmetry of visibility that, in the analogical world, was a prerogative of the established power? These question will be operationalized and tested on the field studying two political events: The V-Day (September 8, 2007) and the No B-Day (December 5, 2009). These two events were symbols of the digital political participation in Italy. The conclusions argue that the political mediators still have their traditional role and importance (although the relations with the digital public sphere is often controversial), yet it is possible everyday more possible to break the asymmetry of visibility and to give voice to unrepresented claims.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Analysis of Youtube videos used by activists in the Uyghur Nationalist Movement: combining quantitative and qualitative methods

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper explores the uses of YouTube by Uyghur nationalist movement activists and studies various ideological codes used by different communities to promote their messages. It argues that several ideological codes are produced in order to challenge the dominant ideologies promoted by the Chinese government, which create a ground for Uyghur imagined solidarity across physical borders. Analysis of production of audio-visual messages by the dispersed ethnic group provides an important window into how ethnic identity is forged by means of Web 2.0

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Precari per sempre? Nuove forme di comunicazione per nuove lotte

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The paper analyses the actions and communication practices used by the movement of precarious workers in the past ten years. The story of this movement represents a grass roots approach in which their actions, through culture-building, have shown that this type of living and working condition should be recognized as a social problem. This movement offers us an example of how many social movements have used internet and online technologies in an innovated way, with communication skills that adapt themselves to the transformations and the types of participation found within cultures and contemporary societies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: L impatto della tecnologia digitale sulla sociologia visuale: opportunit e sfide

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The article proposes an original way of categorizing the visual sociology techniques, and assesses the changes caused by the digital revolution in the visual techniques of social research focusing on the new research fields, the new tools, and the new role of the researcher.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: YouTube e civic commercial engagement. Il caso Obama Girl e Barely Political

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Interesting new forms of communication crossed Obama s political campaign, especially in the Web 2.0 environment. This paper analyzes the phenomenon of Barely Political s YouTube videos. The main and most famous Barely Political s character is Obama Girl, who gained a resounding success during all the stages of Obama s campaign, both on the Web and other traditional media. This paper critically analyzes the communication of Barely Political, assessing its effectiveness and finding out a professional communicative strategy behind what several early observers defined as a Web 2.0 nave amateur participation. This paper presents the outcomes of a field research on the first two years of Barely Political s communication: from June 2007 to May 2009. The article takes into consideration all the 264 videos produced by the staff, paying attention not only to the content but also to the metadata (tags) and the paratextual information (views, comments, ratings, etc.). The outcomes lead the author to define Barely Political project as a form of civic commercial engagement, having both civic and commercial strategic goals.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Media and Communication Studies. Interventions and intersections. The intellectual work of the 2010 ecrea european media and communication doctoral summer school

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper is aimed at reflecting upon the relationship between media, participation and the State of Democracy. Here follows a model combining four different factors: i) the first factor is related to the shared experience of politics, and concerns the role played by individual and collective political actions. The last three factors are meant at explaing citizens experiences and attitudes towards politics, and the forms of participation they are engaged in: ii) formal institutional system; iii) media system; iv) state of cultural flows. These factors can be shaped either by activism (of traditional type or related to online social networks) and or by public debate (in traditional media or in the blogosphere). Our analysis of the four factors is approached from a point of view which constantly relates to the tradition of civic cultures. Our hypothesis is that political culture affects the use of media and that this has an impact on the state of democracy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Local political subcultures and party activism in Italy: the case study of the Democratic Party

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: While relevant studies exist both on local political subcultures and party activism in Italy, the literature misses relevant studies on the relations between these two social and political phenomena. This article aims at bridging this lack presenting a typology of the local branches of the Italian PD (Democratic Party), based on the relations between the features of party activism and the local political subcultures. Four types of local PD branches emerge: the showcase branch, the administrative branch, the company branch and the committee branch. The article discusses each type presenting some extracts of the forty in-depth interviews collected during the field research. At the end of the article some insights on the relations between local political subcultures and party activism in Italy will be drawn.
